questions.question_text:
You are configuring auditing for Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Which two operations can you audit? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

discussion.content: I think it is A, C

choices.B: Set the Sync to Outlook settings to None Selected for the individual’s security role.
choices.D: Set the Use Dynamics 365 App for Outlook to None Selected for the individual’s security role.
choices.A: Set the Web Mail Merge settings to None Selected for the individual’s security role.
choices.C: Set the Dynamics 365 Address Book settings to None Selected for the individual’s security role.

questions.question_text:
You administer a Microsoft Dynamics 365 environment for a company.
You need to prevent one specific employee from synchronizing data by using Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Outlook without preventing the employee from using
Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Outlook.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Correct Answer is C. Refer to the following MS Documentation article to understand why.
Link: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-engagement/outlook-app/v8/deploy-dynamics-365-app-for-outlook

choices.A: In Settings, open Apps for Dynamics 365.
choices.D: Download and install the app from Microsoft AppSource.
choices.C: Enable the option to automatically add the app to Outlook.
choices.B: Add your user name to the Microsoft Dynamics 365 App for Outlook eligible user list.

questions.question_text:
You need to install the Microsoft Dynamics 365 App for Outlook on your device.
What should you do?

You plan to integrate data from an external system into Microsoft Dynamics 365.
You need to create a Microsoft Dynamics 365 field to use for matching records from the external system.
What should you create?

You need to display data that is referenced by a lookup field on a form.
Which option should you use?
